result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon E. Crum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent's approval.

Assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the department. 
Court finds defendant eligible for CIP and SAP.
Court orders bond money to be returned to surety. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:35 am 
INCLUDES 14CF99 AND 14CF100. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan.
State notes sentencing agreement. 
Def makes statement. Atty Jackan makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: In 14CF99: Ct. 1 >> 8 years imprisonment to run concurrent to each other - 3 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision and payment of court costs. 
                           : In 14CF100: Ct. 1 >> 8 years imprisonment to run concurrent to each other- 3 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision and payment of court costs. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES: assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent approval; payment of any unpaid court costs. 
COURT finds def is entitled to 6 days jail credit in both files. 
COURT finds def eligibe for CIP and SAP. 
Atty Jackan requests 48 hour furlough before def begins sentence. State objects. 
COURT remands def to the custody of the sheriff's dept for transport to the WI State Prison System. 
Atty Jackan requests bond be returned to surety. COURT grants.
